name: Pina Colada Cupcakes
author: Samantha S
summary: Scrumptious pineapple cake, slathered in brandy and coated with coconut frosting. Moist and tastes just like a pina colada!
ingredients: 1 (8 ounce) can crushed pineapple, well drained
¼ cup brandy, or as needed, divided
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Line 35 cupcake cups with paper liners
Beat sugar, butter, and oil together in a bowl with an electric mixer until creamy and fluffy
Beat in eggs one at a time
Stir in pineapple, milk, and 1/4 cup brandy
Sift flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together in another bowl
Add slowly to the sugar mixture, beating with an electric hand mixer to get a light, fluffy batter
Spoon batter into the cupcake liners, leaving about 1/8 inch of each liner free (this cake doesn't rise a lot)
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of a cupcake comes out clean, about 17 minutes
Remove from the oven and immediately spoon 1 teaspoon of brandy over the top of each cupcake; let seep into the cake
Beat cream of coconut and cream cheese together with an electric mixer until it is lump-free
